headliner 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Compare two columns within a data frame

Source: R/compare-columns.R
compare_columns.Rd

Compare two columns within a data frame

compare_columns(df, cols = everything(), calc = list(mean = mean))

Arguments

df

data frame
cols

columns to compare, supports select helpers like 'starts_with()' or 'where(is.numeric)'
calc

named list of the functions to use, ex: list(mean = mean, sd = sd) 'purrr' style phrases are also supported like list(mean = ~mean(.x, na.rm = TRUE), sd = sd)

Examples

compare_columns(flights_jfk, )
#> Warning: argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA
#> Warning: argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA
#> Warning: argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA

compare_columns(flights_jfk, ends_with("delay"))
#> $mean_arr_delay
#> [1] 0.1459121
#> 
#> $mean_dep_delay
#> [1] 10.41128
#>
